entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 6:16PM AKST until January 15 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LONG DURATION SNOW EVENT CONTINUING INTO THE NEW WORK WEEK... .As a system positions itself across the northern gulf, moisture is being steered into the Panhandle, with widespread precipitation enveloping the north and central areas. Through the day warmer temperatures have penetrated inland, with many observation sites rising a few degrees by Monday afternoon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 4:36PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Minor Coastal Flooding Possible Monday Into Tuesday... A strong storm developing to the western Bering Sea today will move to the Northern Bering Sea tonight, then into the Central Chukchi Sea on Monday, and then north of Utqiagvik on Tuesday. entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Lower Kobuk Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula; Shishmaref

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 4:36PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: A strong storm developing to the western Bering Sea today will move to the Northern Bering Sea tonight, then into the Central Chukchi Sea on Monday, and then north of Utqiagvik on Tuesday. This storm will bring south winds of 50 to 70 mph to the West Coast of Alaska on Monday. This could water levels along the coast to rise 3 to 5 feet from Shishmaref to Kivalina.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island; Yukon Delta Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 7:09PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY BLACK ICE AND SLIPPERY ROADS TONIGHT... With temperatures expected to drop into the 10s overnight, any untreated surfaces may become slippery due to the snow that fell during the snow squalls/showers earlier today. Patchy black ice is also possible due to the refreezing of melted snow. Motorists are urged to use caution if traveling tonight.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 7:09PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY BLACK ICE AND SLIPPERY ROADS TONIGHT... With temperatures expected to drop into the 10s overnight, any untreated surfaces may become slippery due to the snow that fell during the snow squalls/showers earlier today. Patchy black ice is also possible due to the refreezing of melted snow. Motorists are urged to use caution if traveling tonight.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 7:09PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY BLACK ICE AND SLIPPERY ROADS TONIGHT... With temperatures expected to drop into the 10s overnight, any untreated surfaces may become slippery due to the snow that fell during the snow squalls/showers earlier today. Patchy black ice is also possible due to the refreezing of melted snow. Motorists are urged to use caution if traveling tonight.
